channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: A 'special day' for Eze - but can anyone challenge Arsenal for title?
item.description: After Eberechi Eze's hat-trick helps Arsenal to a 4-1 win against Tottenham, BBC Sport takes a closer look at the Gunners' title challenge.

item.title: Rogers 'only getting better' - will he win England battle?
item.description: After his double against Leeds, can Morgan Rogers win the battle for England's number 10 role over Jude Bellingham, Phil Foden and Cole Palmer?

item.title: 'Painful' and 'no fight' - Spurs sorry for derby display
item.description: Tottenham manager Thomas Frank and goalkeeper Guglielmo Vicario have apologised to fans following Sunday's hapless performance against Arsenal in the north London derby.

item.title: No panic from McInnes but is Hearts' form a worry?
item.description: After Hearts lose in the Scottish Premiership for the first time this season, should the league leaders be concerned about their recent wobble?

item.title: Eze hits hat-trick as Arsenal thrash Tottenham
item.description: Eberechi Eze scores a hat-trick to help Arsenal thump rivals Tottenham 4-1 and go six points clear at the top of the Premier League - despite a moment of magic from Richarlison.

item.title: Leeds fans divided - but Farke defiant as pressure mounts
item.description: If Daniel Farke is heading towards the exit door as Leeds manager, he is determined to go down swinging and on his own terms.

item.title: Rogers nets twice as Villa come from behind to beat Leeds
item.description: Morgan Rogers scores a second-half double as Aston Villa fight back to beat Leeds 2-1 at Elland Road and leave Daniel Farke's side in the relegation zone.

item.title: How Arsenal and Tottenham players rated
item.description: BBC Sport senior football correspondent Sami Mobkel rates the players after Arsenal's 4-1 win against Tottenham in the north London derby.

item.title: Real Madrid sorry for Jota and Andre Silva tribute error
item.description: Real Madrid apologise for a mistake in a video paying tribute to Diogo Jota and his brother Andre Silva.

item.title: Forest inflict stunning defeat on Liverpool at Anfield
item.description: Goals by Murillo, Nicolo Savona and Morgan Gibbs-White condemn Liverpool to their sixth defeat in seven Premier League games as Nottingham Forest put on a brilliant display to win 3-0 at Anfield.

item.title: Barnes fires Newcastle to victory against Man City
item.description: Harvey Barnes scores twice as Newcastle put a dent in Manchester City's title charge and grab three points in the Premier League at St James' Park.

item.title: Neto and Fernandez give Chelsea win at Burnley
item.description: Goals from Pedro Neto and Enzo Fernandez give Chelsea a 2-0 victory against Burnley at Turf Moor.

item.title: Palace into top four as Edwards loses first game as Wolves boss
item.description: Crystal Palace comfortably beat Wolverhampton Wanderers to move into fourth in the Premier League and condemn Rob Edwards to a defeat in his first game in charge at Wolves.

item.title: Bournemouth come from two goals down in dramatic draw against West Ham
item.description: Substitute Enes Unal scores to help Bournemouth come from two goals down and secure a dramatic draw against West Ham at Vitality Stadium.

item.title: Fulham beat Sunderland with late Jimenez winner
item.description: Raul Jimenez scores a late winner to give Fulham a well-deserved win over Sunderland in the Premier League at Craven Cottage.

item.title: Brighton come from behind to beat Brentford
item.description: Jack Hinshelwood scores on his return from injury to help Brighton come from behind to beat Brentford 2-1 in the Premier League.

item.title: Arsenal 'dominated every part of the game' - Arteta
item.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta praises Eberechi Eze's all-round play after a dominant performance from his side in the North London derby at The Emirates.

item.title: Frank apologises to Spurs fans after 'extremely painful' defeat
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur boss Thomas Frank apologises to fans for their performance in an "extremely painful" 4-1 defeat by Arsenal.

item.title: Leeds were 'not good enough' - Farke
item.description: Leeds manager Daniel Farke says his side were "not good enough", after throwing away their one-goal lead against Aston Villa to lose at Elland Road.

item.title: How Forest exploited Liverpool's weaknesses
item.description: Former Manchester United and Everton striker Wayne Rooney explains how Sean Dyche's Nottingham Forest side exploited Liverpool's weaknesses in their 3-0 win at Anfield.

item.title: Liverpool need to 'go back to basics' as Van Dijk voices frustrations
item.description: Wayne Rooney and Rob Green reflect on Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk's post-match interview after Liverpool lost 3-0 to Nottingham Forest at Anfield.

item.title: 'Liverpool in full-blown crisis and Slot under severe pressure'
item.description: The Anfield horror show at the hands of Nottingham Forest was a headlong fall into the abyss for Liverpool, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

item.title: Sheff Utd can decide direction of season - Wilder
item.description: Sheffield United boss Chris Wilder says it is up to his side what they do with their season after cruising to victory in the Steel City derby.

item.title: Adeyemi prefers Arsenal to Man Utd - Sunday's gossip
item.description: Karim Adeyemi would choose Arsenal over Manchester United, Jadon Sancho will have to halve his wages to join Borussia Dortmund, Robert Lewandowski rejects Fenerbahce offer, plus more.

item.title: Welbeck and Wilson - might old guard make England World Cup squad?
item.description: Callum Wilson and Danny Welbeck have drifted to the periphery of the international stage in recent years, but that might be about to change.

item.title: Former longest serving manager in world dies aged 90
item.description: Roly Howard's 33-year tenure in charge of Marine AFC saw him gain a world record at the time.

item.title: Howe finally beats Guardiola - how Newcastle stopped Man City
item.description: After previously "trying everything", Newcastle manager Eddie Howe beats Pep Guardiola's Manchester City for the first time in the top flight at his 17th attempt.

item.title: O'Neill calls for Celtic 'unification' - but is fan unrest affecting team?
item.description: Interim manager Martin O'Neill says Celtic need "some sort of unification", after fans once again called for changes in the way the club is run during their win at St Mirren.

item.title: Why were Livingston denied 'clear, clear penalty' against Rangers?
item.description: Livingston manager David Martindale questions why his side were denied "a clear, clear penalty" in their defeat by Rangers at Ibrox.

item.title: 'We are used to it' - should Man City have been awarded a penalty?
item.description: Manchester City felt they were on the wrong end of some contentious decisions in their defeat by Newcastle - although Pep Guardiola said "everything is fine".

item.title: How Forest tactically exposed Liverpool
item.description: BBC Sport looks at how Nottingham Forest exposed Liverpool's tactical flaws in their 3-0 win at Anfield.

item.title: 'Why it's time for women's FA Cup prize money to be same as men's'
item.description: On women's FA Cup second-round weekend, Lewes FC director Ben Hall makes the case for equal prize money for women's and men's teams.

item.title: 'I haven't got a magic wand' - Edwards faces impossible job at Wolves
item.description: New Wolves boss Rob Edwards shown the scale of club's challenge to stay in Premier League following 2-0 home defeat by Crystal Palace.

item.title: Cunha misses Christmas lights switch-on after 'training accident'
item.description: Man Utd forward Matheus Cunha misses Altrincham's Christmas lights switch-on after "an accident in training", according to the event's organisers.

item.title: 'It's my responsibility' - Slot says Liverpool in 'very bad spell'
item.description: Liverpool manager Arne Slot admits his team are in "a very bad spell", and says recent poor results are his responsibility, after a 3-0 defeat by Nottingham Forest at Anfield.

item.title: Forest are learning quickly - Dyche
item.description: Nottingham Forest manager Sean Dyche says his side are "learning quickly" after a stunning 3-0 win against champions Liverpool at Anfield.

item.title: How wide players helped Newcastle beat Man City
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Rob Green explains how Newcastle's full-backs and wingers helped Eddie Howe's side beat Manchester City 2-1 at St James' Park.

item.title: Newcastle 'close to our best' in win over Man City - Howe
item.description: Newcastle United boss Eddie Howe is delighted after his "brave and ambitious" side were "close to their best" in their 2-1 win over Manchester City at St James' Park.

item.title: No Eze, no problem - how Pino made Palace 'tick' against Wolves
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Wayne Rooney explains how Yeremy Pino has risen to the challenge of replacing Eberechi Eze after Crystal Palace beat Wolverhampton Wanderers 2-0 at Molineux.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v singer Olly Murs
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on singer Olly Murs - and AI - with his predictions for this weekend's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: 'I'll need a lot more goals' - Bowie on battle for Scotland place
item.description: Kieron Bowie is back among the goals for Hibs but knows he will need to keep on finding the net to have a chance of returning to the World Cup-bound Scotland squad.

item.title: Was Oxtoby's Northern Ireland tenure a success?
item.description: After it was announced she would leave Northern Ireland to join Newcastle United, was Tanya Oxtoby's tenure as manager a success?

item.title: Why it was always Arsenal for 'part-time barista' Saka
item.description: England winger Bukayo Saka sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about his love for Arsenal and living in his "coffee era".

item.title: Are you not being entertained? The decline of the open-play goal
item.description: Open-play goals have been on the decline this season and BBC Sport takes a closer look at the trend.

item.title: Have we seen the last of Wales and ex-Arsenal star Ramsey?
item.description: Wales captain Aaron Ramsey has no club and has not played for his country for 14 months, so where and what next for the ex-Arsenal midfielder?

item.title: How does Arsenal defence compare to Premier League's best?
item.description: Where do Arsenal's back four rank in terms of the best ever in the Premier League?

item.title: The non-league striker proving a match for Haaland
item.description: A Merthyr Town striker is proving more than a match for Erling Haaland with his impressive goal-scoring form.

item.title: 'Scotland cash in almost 30 years of glorious failure as dreams come true'
item.description: A generation of Scotland fans witness the greatest game of their lives on an astonishing night at Hampden. Nick McPheat was among them.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: How to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend
item.description: BBC Sport Ask Me Anything explains how to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend.

item.title: Why are Man Utd not playing on a Saturday for two months?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains why Manchester United are not playing on a Saturday for two months

item.title: Who is not going to the 2026 World Cup?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at which countries and players will not be competing at the 2026 World Cup

item.title: What is Scotland's World Cup record?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at how Scotland have fared in previous World Cup competitions.

item.title: Who has qualified for World Cup and when is draw?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore when the World Cup draw is, how the seeding works and who has qualified so far.

item.title: Why VAR gets involved in some penalties but not others
item.description: It was a weekend of VAR penalty decisions in the Premier League, with spot-kicks awarded, cancelled and ignored. BBC Sport explains why.

item.title: Why do footballers tape up their wrists?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explains why footballers use tape to wrap their wrists.

item.title: Scotland edge out Denmark in six-goal epic to reach World Cup
item.description: Watch the best of the action as Scotland beat Denmark 4-2 to reach the men's World Cup finals for the first time since 1998.

item.title: 'I couldn't get Jota out my head' - what Scotland's heroes said
item.description: Scotland's players talk, and talk, and talk after sealing a place in the men's World Cup for the first time since 1998 with a scarcely believable 4-2 victory over Denmark.

item.title: Was McTominay overhead kick not even Scotland's best goal of the night?
item.description: Scotland scored three stunning goals in their era-defining win over Denmark - but which was the best?

item.title: How has world changed since Scotland were last at men's finals?
item.description: When Scotland last reached a men's World Cup, the Scottish parliament didn't exist, Google wasn't a thing and a pint of lager was roughly Â£1.90.

item.title: 'I woke up this morning with no nerves' - Clarke hails Scotland players
item.description: Head coach Steve Clarke hails his Scotland players after they qualify for a first men's World Cup since 1998.

item.title: Drenthe's manager confident of 'successful recovery' from stroke
item.description: Royston Drenthe's manager remains confident the former Real Madrid and Everton winger will make "a successful recovery" after his stroke.

item.title: Rice, Yamal and Brentford women's goal among Puskas & Marta nominees
item.description: Brentford women's Ashley Cheatley is included alongside Declan Rice and Lamine Yamal on Fifa's shortlist for the best goals of the past year.

item.title: Real's Endrick closes in on Lyon loan
item.description: Real Madrid are in advanced talks with Lyon over sending 19-year-old forward Endrick on loan to the Ligue 1 side in January.

item.title: Meet the man who played in two games, in two countries... in one day
item.description: BBC Sport tells the story of Soren Lerby, who once played for Denmark and Bayern Munich on the same day - in different countries.

item.title: Turkish FA bans 102 players in betting probe
item.description: Turkey's Football Federation gives bans to 102 players from its top two divisions for "betting-related activities".

item.title: Messi return to Barcelona unrealistic - president
item.description: Barcelona president Joan Laporta says a Lionel Messi tribute match in front of 105,000 fans at a renovated Nou Camp would be "wonderful".

item.title: Mainz lose court appeal over El Ghazi wrongful dismissal
item.description: German club Mainz have lost a court appeal for wrongful dismissal by Dutch winger Anwar El Ghazi over social media posts regarding the Israel-Gaza conflict.

item.title: Oxtoby leaves NI to take over at Newcastle
item.description: Tanya Oxtoby leaves her role as Northern Ireland manager to become head coach at WSL 2 side Newcastle United.

item.title: Morocco's AS FAR claim second African Women's Champions League title
item.description: AS FAR beat debutants ASEC Mimosas 2-1 in the African Women's Champions League final to become continental champions for the second time.

item.title: Man Utd progress in Champions League - what do Arsenal and Chelsea need?
item.description: BBC Sport assesses how Arsenal, Chelsea and Man Utd have fared so far in this season's Women's Champions League with two league phase rounds remaining.

item.title: 'Best display of season' but Chelsea rue missed opportunity
item.description: Having suffered plenty of past heartache at Barcelona's expense, Chelsea may have ordinarily celebrated a 1-1 Women's Champions League draw - but this was a missed opportunity.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
